definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: The maximum displacement force in the cushion is 4, 500 kN.
sentences.chinese: 此液压垫的最大公称力是4，500kN。

sentences.english: D is the pipeline nominal diameter, when the necessity should establish the rectifier unit.
sentences.chinese: 是管道公称直径，必要时应设置整流装置。

sentences.english: Also, the nominal thickness shall not be less than the minimum required thickness of connecting cylindrical shell.
sentences.chinese: 而且，公称厚度不得小于柱形连接处的最小要求厚度。

sentences.english: Channel diameter of the valve is based on the nominal pipe diameter for manufacturing.
sentences.chinese: 阀门的通道直径是按管子的公称直径进行制造的。

sentences.english: It should be considered when choosing the value of nominal cover for design.
sentences.chinese: 在设计中选择保护层公称厚度时，应该考虑这一标准。

sentences.english: Nominal pressure solenoid valve should be more than the maximum working pressure tube.
sentences.chinese: 电磁阀公称压力应超过管内最高工作压力。

sentences.english: The nominal diameter is generally the major diameter of the thread.
sentences.chinese: 公称直径一般是指螺纹的大径。

definition: Minister of imperial stud, originally charged with horse breeding/same as 太僕寺卿|太仆寺卿[Tai4 pu2 si4 qing1]
shining metal/(old) the 16th of the month (abbreviation used in telegrams)
Grand Scribe, the title by which Sima Qian 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1] refers to himself in Records of the Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4]
posthumous name or title/to confer a posthumous title
ancient unit of weight equal to 20 or 24 liang 兩|两[liang3]
